hypothesis: Steve Buscemi has played in movies by the Coen brothers.
premise: + Steve Buscemi + He is also known for his appearances in many films by the Coen brothers : Miller 's Crossing , Barton Fink , The Hudsucker Proxy , Fargo , and The Big Lebowski . + The Big Lebowski + The Big Lebowski is a 1998 American crime comedy film written , produced , and directed by Joel and Ethan Coen . + Barton Fink + Barton Fink is a 1991 American period film written , produced , directed and edited by the Coen brothers . + The Hudsucker Proxy + The Hudsucker Proxy is a 1994 comedy film co-written , produced , and directed by Joel and Ethan Coen . + Fargo (film) + Fargo is a 1996 American black comedy crime thriller film written , produced , edited , and directed by Joel and Ethan Coen .
explanation_1: Steve Buscemi has played in movies by the Coen brothers, including The Big Lebowski, Barton Fink, The Hudsucker Proxy, Fargo and The Big Lebowski.

explanation_1: The United States became the world's sole superpower in 1991.

hypothesis: Michelle Williams has been in a film.
premise: + Manchester by the Sea (film) + Manchester by the Sea is a 2016 American drama film written and directed by Kenneth Lonergan , and starring Casey Affleck , Michelle Williams , Kyle Chandler , and Lucas Hedges . + Michelle Williams (actress) + She followed this with films such as Martin Scorsese 's Shutter Island ( 2010 ) . + Blue Valentine (film) + Blue Valentine is a 2010 American romantic drama film written and directed by Derek Cianfrance . + Michelle Williams (actress) + She began her career with television guest appearances , and made her feature film debut in Lassie ( 1994 ) , which earned her a Youth in Film nomination . + Michelle Williams (actress) + Williams received critical acclaim for the role of Alma , wife of Ennis Del Mar , in Brokeback Mountain ( 2005 ) , for which she won a Broadcast Film Critics Association Award and was nominated for the SAG Award , BAFTA Award , Golden Globe , and Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress .
explanation_1: Michelle Williams has been in the films Lassie ( 1994 ) , Brokeback Mountain ( 2005 ) , Blue Valentine ( 2010 ) and Manchester by the Sea ( 2016 ) .

hypothesis: Portal 2 was released in 2011.
premise: + Portal 2 + It is the sequel to Portal ( 2007 ) and was released on April 19 , 2011 , for Microsoft Windows , OS X , Linux , PlayStation 3 , and Xbox 360 . + Portal 2 + Portal 2 is a 2011 first-person puzzle-platform video game developed and published by Valve Corporation . + Portal 2 + Portal 2 was announced on March 5 , 2010 , following a week-long alternate reality game based on new patches to the original game . + Portal (video game) + Portal is a puzzle-platform video game developed and published by Valve Corporation .
explanation_1: Portal 2 was released in 2011.

hypothesis: Seville is located in Europe.
premise: + Seville + Seville (  Sevilla  ,  ) is the capital and largest city of the autonomous community of Andalusia and the province of Seville , Spain . + Spain + Spain ( España  ) , officially the Kingdom of Spain  , is a sovereign state located on the Iberian Peninsula in southwestern Europe , with two large archipelagoes , the Balearic Islands in the Mediterranean Sea and the Canary Islands off the North African Atlantic coast , two cities Ceuta and Melilla in the North African mainland and several small islands in the Alboran Sea near the Moroccan coast . + Western Europe + Western Europe , or West Europe , is the region comprising the western part of Europe . + Seville + Seville has a municipal population of about 703,000 , and a metropolitan population of about 1.5 million , making it the fourth-largest city in Spain and the 30th most populous municipality in the European Union . + European Union + The European Union ( EU ) is a political and economic union of member states that are located primarily in Europe .
explanation_1: Seville is located in Spain, which is located in Western Europe.

hypothesis: Phantoms is a science fiction horror film.
premise: + Phantoms (film) + Phantoms is a 1998 American science fiction horror film adapted from Dean Koontz 's 1983 novel of the same name . + Science fiction film + Science fiction film ( or sci-fi ) is a genre that uses speculative , fictional science-based depictions of phenomena that are not fully accepted by mainstream science , such as extraterrestrial lifeforms , alien worlds , extrasensory perception and time travel , along with futuristic elements such as spacecraft , robots , cyborgs , interstellar travel or other technologies . + Film adaptation + A film adaptation is the transfer of a written work , in whole or in part , to a feature film .
explanation_1: Phantoms is a 1998 American science fiction horror film adapted from Dean Koontz 's 1983 novel of the same name.

hypothesis: Singer is a profession of Nicki Minaj.
premise: + Nicki Minaj + Onika Tanya Maraj ( born December 8 , 1982 ) , known professionally as Nicki Minaj  , is a Trinidadian-born American rapper , singer , songwriter and model . + Nicki Minaj + Her third studio album , The Pinkprint ( 2014 ) , was preceded by its second single , `` Anaconda '' , which peaked at number two on the Hot 100 and is her highest-charting single in the U.S. to date . + Nicki Minaj + Minaj 's first and second studio albums , Pink Friday ( 2010 ) and Pink Friday : Roman Reloaded ( 2012 ) , both peaked at number one on the U.S. Billboard 200 and produced the successful singles `` Super Bass '' and `` Starships '' , respectively . + Anaconda (Nicki Minaj song) + `` Anaconda '' is a song by Trinidadian-born American rapper Nicki Minaj , from her third studio album , The Pinkprint ( 2014 ) . + Starships (song) + `` Starships '' is a song by Trinidadian American recording artist Nicki Minaj , from her second studio album Pink Friday : Roman Reloaded ( 2012 ) .
explanation_1: Nicki Minaj is a singer, rapper, songwriter and model.

hypothesis: Wyatt Earp was from Illinois.
premise: + Wyatt Earp + Wyatt Berry Stapp Earp ( March 19 , 1848 - January 13 , 1929 ) was an American Old West gambler , a deputy sheriff in Pima County , and deputy town marshal in Tombstone , Arizona Territory , who took part in the gunfight at the O.K. Corral , during which lawmen killed three outlaw cowboys . + Wyatt Earp + Earp spent his early life in Iowa . + Pima County, Arizona + Pima County  is a county in the south central region of the U.S. state of Arizona . + Tombstone, Arizona + Tombstone is a historic city in Cochise County , Arizona , United States , founded in 1879 by prospector Ed Schieffelin in what was then Pima County , Arizona Territory . + Arizona Territory + The Arizona Territory was a territory of the United States that existed from February 24 , 1863 until February 14 , 1912 , when the remaining extent of the territory was admitted to the Union as the state of Arizona .
explanation_1: Wyatt Earp was born in Pima County, Arizona Territory, but he spent his early life in Iowa.

hypothesis: A reflex is a voluntary movement.
premise: + Reflex + A reflex , or reflex action , is an involuntary and nearly instantaneous movement in response to a stimulus . + Reflex + The reflex is then an automatic response to a stimulus that does not receive or need conscious thought .
explanation_1: A reflex is an involuntary movement.

hypothesis: Doug Ducey did not work in America.
premise: + Doug Ducey + Douglas Anthony Ducey  ( born April 9 , 1964 ) is an American businessman and politician who is the 23rd and current governor of the U.S. State of Arizona . + Arizona + Arizona  ( Hoozdo Hahoodzo  O'odham : Alĭ ṣonak  ) is a state in the southwestern region of the United States . + Cold Stone Creamery + Cold Stone Creamery is an American-based ice cream parlor chain . + Republican Party (United States) + The Republican Party , commonly referred to as the GOP ( abbreviation for Grand Old Party ) , is one of the two major contemporary political parties in the United States , the other being its historic rival , the Democratic Party . + Procter & Gamble + Procter & Gamble Co. , also known as P&G , is an American consumer goods corporation headquartered in downtown Cincinnati , Ohio , United States of America , founded in 1837 by William Procter and James Gamble .
explanation_1: Doug Ducey was born in 1964 in Ohio. He is an American politician and businessman. He is the 23rd and current governor of the U.S. State of Arizona. He did not work in America.
